product.text:
Winnie the Pooh and the Honey Tree

Based on the classic tale of trickery and overindulgence by A.A. Milne, this story unfolds as a very hungry Pooh develops a scheme to lure honeybees away from their luscious stash. When Pooh’s plan backfires, he overindulges in honey at Rabbit’s house, only to find that he is too plump to fit through Rabbit’s door. Rabbit and the Hundred Acre Wood gang make the best of a bad situation by waiting patiently for Pooh to slim down enough to slip through the door. The book’s underlying message encourages young readers to practice moderation and respect for nature, and to recognize that good manners will always serve them well.

Tie-in Activity: Ask your child to identify the consequences of overindulgences, such as eating too much candy or watching too much TV. Then, help your child list healthy alternatives for each of these activities.
